attributes.action: To reopen Mental Health Care to the people who need it
attributes.additional_details: Because they are the only people who can, they are in control of what the NHS can and can't do so they need to do this, they need to implement these changes to help people who were already struggling before and are struggling potentially more so now
attributes.background: I would like the government to reopen the mental health service to people who need them. 99% of non essential things have been restored and yet things such as support workers, CPN's (community psychiatric nurses) and therapies have still not been restored. This is wrong and can be massively damaging

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government aren't responsible for the issue you raise. This is an operational matter for the NHS.

Since you started this petition, the NHS has issued new guidance for trusts, including "Accelerating the return to near-normal levels of non-Covid health services". You can read the full guidance here: https://www.england.nhs.uk/coronavirus/wp-content/uploads/sites/52/2020/07/Phase-3-letter-July-31-2020.pdf

We have published petitions calling for more funding for mental health which you may wish to sign:
Fund more support for mental health:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/300585

Emergency funding increase for mental health services due to Covid -19 pandemic: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/307724
